text: Kamil Piatkowski (born 21 June 2000) is a professional footballer from Poland. He plays for Austrian Bundesliga club FC Red Bull Salzburg and the Poland national team as center back. ==Club career== Piątkowski started in the youth teams of Karpaty Krosno and Zagłębie Lubin. In the 2019-20 season he went on to Raków Częstochowa. He debuted in August 2019 in the first league versus Lechia Gdańsk. He came in in min. 86 for Sebastian Musiolik. 2021 he went on to FC Red Bull Salzburg where he signed till June 2026.Homepage FC Red Bull Salzburg (German) In Januyry 2023 he was loaned to KAA Gent . For the 2023-24 season he came back to Salzburg. ==International career== Piątkowski made his debut for Poland on 28 March 2021 in a World Cup qualifier against Andorra. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Club Season League National Cup Continental Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Raków Częstochowa 2019–20 Ekstraklasa 24 1 2 0 — — 26 1 2020–21 Ekstraklasa 23 2 5 1 — — 28 3 Total 47 3 7 1 — — 54 4 Red Bull Salzburg 2021–22 Bundesliga 6 0 1 0 1 0 — 8 0 Career total 53 3 8 1 1 0 0 0 62 4 ===International=== National team Year Apps Goals Poland 2021 3 0 Total 3 0 ==Honours== *Polish Cup: 2021 *Ekstraklasa Young Player of the Season: 2021 *Ekstraklasa Young Player of the Month: March 2021, April 2021 * Austrian Champion: 2022 * Austrian Cup: 2022 ==References== Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Polish footballers Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg players Category:Association football defenders Category:Austrian football champions
